caption:
Table 1: Comparison of our model against baselines on the 

Wikidata-Disamb dataset. Best results in dark bold 

outperform the baseline models when fed with our proposed KG 
context. For instance, (cf. Table 1), RoBERTa, with a 1-hop con-
text, can correctly link entities in additional 1127 sample sentences 
in the test set (flipped from incorrect to the correct predictions) 
compared to its vanilla setting. These samples have 997 unique 
Wikidata IDs. These results also indicate that the transformer mod-

caption:
Table 2: Our models against baseline on ISTEX dataset 

els achieve better precision compared to recall; this is clear in table 
2 and interpreted as follows: our model is more likely to classify an 
entity as the correct entity only when it is true (few false positives). 
For brevity, the detailed analysis of each experimental setup and 
corresponding data can be found in our Github 4 . 
Concerning RQ2, our results indicate that including triples from 
higher hop counts either exhibit an inverse impact on the perfor-
mance or have minimal effect on overall model behavior (cf. Table 
1 RoBERTa vs. XLNet 2-hop values)
